title: What are the conditions for implementing the possibility of survival?
first_phrase: In the previous part of the text, the author discusses the relationship between consciousness and the physical body, highlighting the importance of maintaining it through constant assimilation and elimination of external elements. He emphasizes that every living organism craves survival and self-preservation. In the last 200 tokens, the author explains that this drive for life manifests as an instinct for conservation, which propels consciousness to attend to the needs of the body to survive. He presents various forces that threaten this drive, including the need to defend the organism from external forces of destruction. The text also lists some of the few passions that can overcome this drive for life, such as love in all its forms, the preservation of the species, and the desire for inner transformation.

last_phrase: In summary, the deep desire for life acts as an instinct of preservation that stimulates consciousness to care for the organism's needs. Despite the struggles and efforts, individuals are ultimately destined to perish. However, they persist in their attitude and concentrate their attention on the lifelong battle until the end of their cycle, often until death or even a metamorphosis. Hence, it is essential to embrace this desire and continue fighting until the very end.
